channel.title: Help me *not* blow up my axoloti with 9V power
channel.description: I always powered my axoloti with usb. However I'd really like to power from 9V. I have 2x cv.ocd that are powered from a 9V guitar-power adapter-thingie. On the cv.ocd it says "9-12V center neg", and the graphics on the axoloti suggests it's the exact opposite, so I bought a small inverter cable in a guitar store. My meter tells me that the power should be correctly inverted and I assume fit for the axoloti. I'd really appreciate it if someone here could look through the images and verify that it's safe to proceed, plugging the 9V into the axoloti.... Orientation on the meter: Measuring the 9V from the power supply: The inverter cable: Measuring the power from the inverter cable:

item.title: Help me *not* blow up my axoloti with 9V power
item.dc:creator: @a773
item.description:
@a773 wrote:

Thanks alot. both of you!

Plugged it in, and as you said, it works great! Good call on the reverse power diode!

Read full topic
item.source: Help me *not* blow up my axoloti with 9V power

item.title: Help me *not* blow up my axoloti with 9V power
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

That looks right, the inverter does what it should do, you can plug this to power your axoloti!

And as @SmashedTransistors pointed out there is a protection diode.

Read full topic
item.source: Help me *not* blow up my axoloti with 9V power

item.title: Help me *not* blow up my axoloti with 9V power
item.dc:creator: @SmashedTransistors
item.description:
@SmashedTransistors wrote:

Hi @a773,
I found this post by @johannes:

Power Supply for stand alone use

on the DC socket, there is a protection diode for that. Just (re)tested applying 20V reverse polarity, no sign of any damage.
Note that other power inputs (usb socket, solder pads) are not reverse polarity protected.

Read full topic
item.source: Help me *not* blow up my axoloti with 9V power

item.title: Help me *not* blow up my axoloti with 9V power
item.dc:creator: @a773
item.description:
@a773 wrote:

I always powered my axoloti with usb. However I'd really like to power from 9V.

I have 2x cv.ocd that are powered from a 9V guitar-power adapter-thingie. On the cv.ocd it says "9-12V center neg", and the graphics on the axoloti suggests it's the exact opposite, so I bought a small inverter cable in a guitar store. My meter tells me that the power should be correctly inverted and I assume fit for the axoloti.

I'd really appreciate it if someone here could look through the images and verify that it's safe to proceed, plugging the 9V into the axoloti....

Orientation on the meter:

Measuring the 9V from the power supply:

IMG_20180809_192950365.jpg500x608 64.8 KB

The inverter cable:

IMG_20180809_193058508.jpg500x969 92 KB

Measuring the power from the inverter cable:

IMG_20180809_193132948.jpg500x555 57.7 KB

Read full topic
item.source: Help me *not* blow up my axoloti with 9V power
